'''Déorwine''' was the Chief of the [[King's Riders]] during the [[War of the Ring]].

==History==
Déorwine replaced Háma in the post when the latter was killed at [[Helm's Deep]]. He and six of the men under his command ([[Harding]], [[Guthláf]], [[Herefara]], [[Herubrand]], [[Horn]] and [[Fastred (rider of Rohan)|Fastred]]) were slain at the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]].<ref>{{RK|Battle}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name ''Déorwine'' probably means "brave-friend" in [[Old English]], consisting of ''[[Wiktionary:deor#Old English|dēor]]'' ("brave, bold (as a wild beast)" + ''[[Wiktionary:wine#Old English|wine]]'' ("friend").<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 571</ref>
